message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,100,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it very valuable. Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value of your product. I would like to propose a counteroffer of $1,050,000 for the product. I believe this price reflects its true worth while also allowing me to save some money.

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer, but $1,050,000 is still a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,080,000, which is a fair price considering the value of the product. I'm sure you'll agree that this offer is a good deal for both of us.

I understand your position, Alice. I've reviewed our previous discussions and am willing to increase my offer to $1,070,000. This still allows me to save some money, while acknowledging the value of your product. I hope this proposal works for you.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further. While $1,070,000 is closer to what I'm looking for, I need to be closer to $1,100,000 to make this deal work for me.  Would you be willing to meet me halfway at $1,085,000? This would allow both of us to walk away feeling good about the agreement.

I've considered your latest offer, Alice, and I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1,072,500. I believe this price reflects the value of your product while allowing me to save some money. I hope this proposal meets your expectations.
